sub_title: Project Manager, PMO, tech, hw/sw - security projects
summary:
Bridging diversity and helping in improving people's lives through leading technology projects.

Led businesses and technology projects with intercultural teams across 5+ time-zones, co-founded an entrepreneurship incubator, made business trips across 4 continents, lived in 5 countries (e.g. Singapore, The Netherlands, Poland, Slovenia, Serbia), and speaks 4 languages with working proficiency, including Polish and Russian.

An internationally-minded, digitally educated and multiculturally competent leader that possesses in-depth experience in developing next practices frameworks to fit specific business environments, as well as being competent in project, program and strategy management.

Within last 2 years, I have managed 20+ projects with €2M+ budget, working on between 2-3 and 9 projects concurrently, with a team of 2-3 to 8 team members per project. I have also received recognition for my results-oriented approach, make-it-work and can-do attitude, as well as my ability to manage data, technology, and people effectively.

For example, I have been instrumental in boosting lessons learned outcomes by a remarkable 80% through continuous improvement and performance assessments, resulting in project budget savings, optimized planning, and effective risk mitigation.

Walking unconventional roads and making a different choice are the solutions that I grasped early in my life. Working with senior leaders that are very much interested in improving people's lives through technology advancements is my daily activity.

HIGHLIGHTS
- 8+ Years in Program, PMO and Project Management
- 8+ Years working in Multicultural Environment (Europe & Asia)
- Within last 2 years managed 20+ projects with €2M+ budget
- Experienced in managing 2-9 projects concurrently
- Project team between 2-3 and 8 team members per project
- Cyber Security and Risk Management Professional 
- Agile Project Management Practitioner 
- Delivered projects in line with MoSCoW framework
- Trained in Strategy Design and Delivery 
- Knowledgeable about AI for business
- Skilled in Microsoft Office tools
- Excellent communication and content development skills
- Hands-on experience in leading and delivering trainings
- Capable of presenting to both small (10) and large groups (150)
- Results-oriented with a keen interest in technology and people
- Experienced working in both remote and hybrid environments
- Worked with cross-functional teams ranging from 2-3 to 50+ team members across Europe, US and Asia,
...
Interested in cooperation? If so, looking forward to connection & fruitful discussion.

treasury_media: [{'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/rethinking-project-management-from-best-practices-tasic-ph-d-', 'title': 'Rethinking Project Management from Best Practices to Next Practices', 'description': 'Enhance - Elevate - Embrace - Engage \nDoing better relates to best practices, however, over the last decade, doing differently has become a norm.\nNext Practice is about tomorrow’s success, and best practices should be simply considered as a starting point to build upon.', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C5112AQGHPjWIFvJNBQ/article-cover_image-shrink_720_1280/0/1529663855713?e=1697673600&v=beta&t=Q5WjSlMUXiodyW9Z_2PGbHcM3vhAPKxymWqPTuqX31Y'}, {'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/brain-gain-drain-matter-change-thinking-improving-lives-velimir-tasic', 'title': 'Brain Gain or Brain Drain? It is a matter of change in thinking and improving the lives of minorities, Erasmus Programme’s 30th Anniversary', 'description': 'Study abroad, “changing lives” & “opening minds” are often mentioned together as an expression of the impact that international mobility has on the lives of students and alumni. Characteristics of each country’s educational systems, uniqueness of student’s personality, skills, socio-economic background, ethnic and social capital are some of the main ingredients that challenge the effects of mobility on the professional life of alumni. ', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C5612AQH392P47RRrGg/article-cover_image-shrink_600_2000/0/1520152614663?e=1697673600&v=beta&t=a9_NiriNsAigWovGqnu3KjhnBq3j60iZrJuq0ZwZ_x8'}, {'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/breaking-wall-project-management-gamification-artificial-tasic', 'title': 'Breaking the Wall of Project Management – Gamification & Artificial Intelligence', 'description': 'Most of us are project SPECIALISTS and just a few are project management (PM) EXPERTS. Often those terms get exchanged and confused forming one of the biggest challenges of our times, i.e. not appreciating a profession due to tradition, bureaucracy, and experiences, in most of the cases.', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C5612AQEcPN-iAkXWPw/article-cover_image-shrink_600_2000/0/1520131196644?e=1697673600&v=beta&t=rtD5BkeO5LqoZ_THyUqDK_ya9oB_bz3Cf8K1uThwjoM'}, {'url': 'http://www.garagerasmus.org/esaa-entrepreneurship-incubator.html', 'title': 'ESAA Entrepreneurship Incubator', 'description': 'Erasmus+ entrepreneurs coming from Belgium, China, Colombia, Croatia, Finland, France, Germany, Italy, Nederland, Poland, Romania, Serbia, Singapore, Spain, Thailand, Turkey, and the United Kingdom, got together in Prague (Czech Republic), for an insightful and thought-provoking experience.', 'image': None}]

awards:
[{'title': 'Extra Mile Award', 'description': 'The recognition for excellent engagement and high contribution to multiple programs development.

ESAA awards recognize those individuals that have made extraordinary contributions to the ESAA and help the ESAA carry out the mission.

Accomplishments such as:

- Exhibits professionalism. The individual exhibits a positive outlook and attitude toward his job (e.g., industriousness, self-motivation, persistence). The individual consistently provides a high level of service while showing respect and courtesy to others.

- Demonstrates initiative and innovation in carrying out the job. 

- Leads or leads by example. Effectively collaborates with others (locally and/or across the Organization) to produce a result.

- Serves the greater good. Results and outcome of individual’s work reflect positively on the Organization, enhances morale, makes ESAA a better place to work, etc.

- Influences others. The individual goes about the routines of his job, day in and day out, with a remarkable attitude and enthusiasm that influences and benefits others.

Examples include the following:
- Took on an unofficial mentoring role to teach or train others,
- Developed processes or systems to reduce workload,
- Took on extra work assignments without formal recognition, to support goals, accomplish objectives,
- Did something(s) to significantly impact/improve team performance, 
- Identified need(s) and initiated appropriate projects or procedures to address them.', 'issuer': 'Erasmus+ Student and Alumni Association', 'date': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, {'title': 'Extra Mile Award', 'description': 'The recognition for excellent engagement and high contribution to multiple programs development.

SPMI awards recognize those individuals that have made extraordinary contributions to the SPMI Chapter and help the PMI carry out the mission.

Accomplishments such as:

- Exhibits professionalism. The individual exhibits a positive outlook and attitude toward his job (e.g., industriousness, self-motivation, persistence). The individual consistently provides a high level of service while showing respect and courtesy to others.

- Demonstrates initiative and innovation in carrying out the job. 

- Leads or leads by example. Effectively collaborates with others (locally and/or across the Institute) to produce a result.

- Serves the greater good. Results and outcome of individual’s work reflect positively on the Chapter, enhances morale, makes SPMI a better place to work, etc.

- Influences others. The individual goes about the routines of his job, day in and day out, with a remarkable attitude and enthusiasm that influences and benefits others.

Examples include the following:
- Developed processes or systems to reduce workload,
- Took on extra work assignments without formal recognition, to support goals, accomplish objectives,
- Did something(s) to significantly impact/improve team performance, 
- Identified need(s) and initiated appropriate projects or procedures to address them.', 'issuer': 'Project Management Institute - Singapore Chapter', 'date': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}]
